nodes.bodyText: @formalhaut69 why is this class deleted?
@arcturus2 I came across it because 4 methods within it were flagged by SQ as empty but it appears that the entire class is unused.
Was this method removed because it wasn't used?
Yeah, it was calling the two methods that SQ flagged as empty. I took a look at it and it was never used within the project
This is a static method, perhaps it was intended as a sort of utility function?

I think so @cygnus-x-1. I put in a break point here and in the dispose() of GlyphManagerOpenGLController and wasn't able to see any of them being executed so I concur that they are not used - even magically.
I thought I'd create an Action in Experimental -> Developer -> Clear Glyph Textures Buffer which basically calls:
SharedDrawable.deleteTextures();
I then got an exception which said "There is no OpenGL context current in the current thread."
So I modified the method to look like this:
        gl.getContext().makeCurrent();
        gl.glDeleteTextures(1, new int[]{iconTextureName}, 0);
        glyphTextureController.dispose(gl);
        gl.getContext().release();

Running this seemed fine but when I then tried to create a new graph I got this exception:
com.jogamp.opengl.GLException: Thread[AWT-EventQueue-1,6,main] glGetError() returned the following error codes after a call to glBindTexture(<int> 0x8C1A, <int> 0x1): GL_INVALID_OPERATION ( 1282 0x502), 
	at com.jogamp.opengl.DebugGL4bc.writeGLError(DebugGL4bc.java:31781)
	at com.jogamp.opengl.DebugGL4bc.glBindTexture(DebugGL4bc.java:730)

	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.utilities.GLTools.loadSharedIconTextures(GLTools.java:799)

	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.renderer.GraphRenderable.lambda$getChangeProcessor$1(GraphRenderable.java:164)
	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.renderer.GraphRenderable.lambda$update$29(GraphRenderable.java:376)
	at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1540)
	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.renderer.GraphRenderable.update(GraphRenderable.java:375)
	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.renderer.GLRenderer.lambda$display$2(GLRenderer.java:165)
	at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1540)
	at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.visual.opengl.renderer.GLRenderer.display(GLRenderer.java:164)
	at jogamp.opengl.GLDrawableHelper.displayImpl(GLDrawableHelper.java:692)
	at jogamp.opengl.GLDrawableHelper.display(GLDrawableHelper.java:674)
	at com.jogamp.opengl.awt.GLCanvas$11.run(GLCanvas.java:1428)
	at jogamp.opengl.GLDrawableHelper.invokeGLImpl(GLDrawableHelper.java:1293)
Caused: com.jogamp.opengl.GLException: Caught GLException: Thread[AWT-EventQueue-1,6,main] glGetError() returned the following error codes after a call to glBindTexture(<int> 0x8C1A, <int> 0x1): GL_INVALID_OPERATION ( 1282 0x502),  on thread AWT-EventQueue-1
	at com.jogamp.opengl.GLException.newGLException(GLException.java:76)

I think given the method isn't used and has serious side effects as it is then its not worth keeping IMO. What do you think @cygnus-x-1 @algol60  @formalhaut69 ?
Was this method removed because it wasn't used?
Yep, this method is called by deleteTextures which is never used.
This has clearly not been implemented, but I'd be cautious here as dispose is a core function in GL so I suspect that it should be implemented to avoid memory leaks on the graphics card.
I think that this could be removed based on my comment https://github.com/constellation-app/constellation/pull/446/files#r413149947

@formalhaut69 as tempting as it is to add breaks here, the fall through is intentional; a way to append all subsequent date formats which I think is clever. Noted that SQ will flag it and understand its reasoning. Not sure what others think but I'd like to mark this as wont fix.
Note that as is this can't be imported because it breaks current functionality and the unit tests; try running TemporalFormattingNGTest and you will see what I mean.
@arcturus2 Okay, no worries. Would you like me to remove these breaks and resubmit the pull request?
Yep - you should revert this particular change and mark the SQ warnings as all good.
@formalhaut69 @arcturus2 @cygnus-x-1 Assuming you are referring to the blocker code smell, I have already done this
It looks like you deleted the overrides in DualGraph...
Yeah I think I came across the issues in locking manager before the ones in DualGraph. I've gone back and removed the unused methods
What I meant was, this comment is no longer valid as you've removed the overridden methods in DualGraph.

@cygnus-x-1 I could be wrong but the valueGetters in all of the classes except for the two you've pointed out do nothing in index 0 so it appears that that's a default case to intentionally do nothing. For some reason in this class and in class IdValueUpdater3, the empty valueGetter is at position 2 of the array instead of 0 so its not the default case. I could not figure out why they've done it like this here. I can change the comment but I'm not sure what to change it to since I can't explain why they've done it differently. Let me know if I'm misunderstanding something.
I missed that context from the snippets I was looking at. I also don't fully understand how the undo stack is working... so i'll take your best judgement here.
